name: Bertolli Phyllo Chicken Triangles
author: Anonymous
summary: Flaky morsels filled with chicken and roasted red peppers are sure to please your guests.
ingredients: ⅓ cup finely chopped shallots or onions
1 (24 ounce) jar Bertolli® Tomato and Basil Sauce
1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, broiled or grilled and shredded
⅓ cup roasted red peppers, drained and chopped
½ cup I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!® Spread, melted
directions: Heat olive oil in 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and cook shallots, stirring occasionally, 3 minutes or until tender
Stir in sauce, chicken, roasted peppers, salt and pepper
Bring to a boil over high heat
Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes
Stir in cheese and pine nuts; let cool
Meanwhile, unfold phyllo and cover with plastic wrap and damp cloth
Working with 4 layered, lightly buttered sheets at a time, cut sheets into 8 equal (2-x 12-in
Place 1 heaping teaspoon chicken mixture on top corner of each strip; fold corner over to opposite edge, forming a triangle
Continue folding, keeping triangle shape with each fold, until rolled completely to end
On ungreased baking sheet, arrange triangles and lightly brush with spread
Bake 12 minutes or until golden brown
To serve, arrange each triangle on serving dish and, if desired, drizzle with additional heated sauce
